fields.description:
# Configure ProjectA to send e-mails on issue create.
# Add the 'Linked Issues' field to the create screen for ProjectA.
# (BUG) Create an issue with a link to another issue in ProjectA. Note that the resulting e-mail does not mention the link you just created.

This same error occurs if you update an issue.

I would expect the issue link to be listed in the updated/created e-mail.
fields.summary: Linking the link from a edit/create/transition screen does not show up in the created/updated e-mail.

fields.description:
When you perform a link operation, JIRA should fire an issue updated event so that you get a e-mail with an indication that a new link was added. 

Current broken behaviour in the Link Dialog:

* Local Link Issue/Remote Link Issue: Sends an e-mail only when the link is commented on. The e-mail generate contains the comment but does not indicate that a link was actually added. We really should send an IssueUpdated event with the change items (containing the link we just added) and any comment from the page. This will produce a e-mail with the link listed as changed.
* Web Link: Does nothing even on a comment.
* Confluence: Does nothing even on a comment.
fields.summary: Link Dialog actions don't send an issue updated e-mail.

fields.description:

2) From the cog menu on that issue, pick "Where is my field?"
3) Choose a field that isn't displayed in GreenHopper's more condensed view, such as Resolution on an open issue.
4) The helper tells you it should be present, but it's not.

!FieldHelper.png!

Also appears in the issue nav and gives even more incorrect answers, as there are even fewer fields visible there.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30431].
  {panel}

We should have a way to disable all callbacks to Atlassian. This would include:

UPM
JIRA Feedback Button
Plugin Feedback buttons (such as GH)
Evaluation JIRA callback

This is important for people using JIRA in an environment where they are on a closed network and DNS timeouts clientside for some of these issues cause massive slowdown.

Current workaround is to nullroute atlassian.com on every single individual machine in the hosts file, or to add a zone entry for atlassian.com to your local DNS server to respond with 127.0.0.1.

There were mentions of this existing already, though I have not been able to find any documentation of it.
fields.summary: Switch to kill all callbacks to Atlassian
Give a possibility to recover the deleted issue
Update "Attach Screenshot" feature to use new technologies

fields.description:
To reproduce the problem, create two field configurations (and field configuration schemes):
* one, where the description field uses "Default Text Renderer"
* one, where the description field uses "Wiki Style Renderer"

As next step create two projects:
* one, using the field configuration scheme with the "Default Text Renderer"
* one, using the field configuration scheme with the "Wiki Style Renderer"

Now create a Task issue in one of these project, and one ore two Sub-Tasks and _type something in the Description field_.

Now move the parrent Task issue to the other project.

You will see: The Sub-Tasks will have empty description fields!

(i) Find out this problem in JIRA 5.0.6, and can reproduce it also in JIRA 5.1.8! (Out-Of-The-Box installation!)
fields.summary: Losing Description of Sub-Tasks when moving parent issue to a project with a different text renderer

fields.description: The work-wrap style was removed from the filter display which causes filters without spaces between commas and field names to not wrap.  As a result the filter spills out onto the middle of the page.

fields.description:
Attach Screenshot no longer works on OS X after Java Update

*Steps to Reproduce:*
After updating OS X (Lion) to the latest Java available through the Software Update, you get:
{noformat}
java version "1.6.0_37"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_37-b06-434-11M3909)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 20.12-b01-434, mixed mode)
{noformat}

When you open an issue and go to the _Attach Screenshot_ option, it asks you to Update the Java Applet and sends you to http://www.java.com/en/download/mac_download.jsp?locale=en if you agree to install. After installing it if you check Firefox Add-ons the plugin is:

!Screen Shot 2012-11-07 at 10.07.18 AM.png!

When you go once again to the _Attach Screenshot_ option, the Applet loads but nothing happens when you click on the _Paste_ button.

*Expected Results:*
Screenshots should be pasted and added to JIRA Issues.

*Actual Results:*
Nothing happens, no errors in the logs or in the screen.

*Workaround:*

Revert the Java Applet update as described in this Apple KB: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT5559?viewlocale=en_US&locale=en_US
fields.summary: Attach Screenshot no longer works after OS X Java Update

E.g. for input 'Xavier Sa' on JAC 3 positions were displayed, but when pressing arrow down to pick second position, the event was not captured by the dropdown, and resulted in the default behaviour - caret moving to the next line (or end of the current line if it was the last one).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30412].
  {panel}

Hi,

Currently, User-Picker field fetches all users including in-active ones. What is the use case in fetching inactive users?

I think the API should fetch active users only or its behaviour should be in align with 'Assignee' field.

Regards,
Dipti Ranjan Behera

----

h4. Steps to Replicate
# Create an User Picker custom field in a system with inactive users.
# Click on the 'Select a user' icon (!browse_users.png!).
# A pop up opens displaying all the users, including inactive ones (URL: http://<JIRA_SERVER>/secure/popups/UserPickerBrowser.jspa?formName=jiraform&multiSelect=false&decorator=popup&element=customfield_<CF_ID>).

h4. Expected Results
Only the active users should be displayed - or it should be possible to at least filter inactive users out.
fields.summary: [User-Picker CF] this field should not fetch inactive users.

fields.description:
If a user is not part of {{jira-users}} group in Global Permission, the user can still logged in to JIRA and pretty much do normal operations in the application if the user have the jira-administrators or system-administrators rights. However, if the user tries to create a filter, the user will be redirected to login page unexpectedly (although the user has already logged in to JIRA). 

The steps to reproduce the problem (Assuming that we are using a vanilla installation):
- Go to User Browser, and exclude an admin user from {{jira-users}} group (jira-users by default is mapped to JIRA Users in Global Permission)
- Go to Permission Schemes, and add {{jira-developers}} to all of the permissions options to grant issue access to the admin user
- Go to Issue Navigator, and perform any searches
- Then try to save the search as a filter, and the login screen will appear instead:
!scshot1.png!

Tested on JIRA 5.1.5 and JIRA 5.1.8
fields.summary: Unable to save a filter if the user is not part of JIRA Users group in Global Permission

fields.description: The screenshots explains the situation.

(x) When you are redirected back to Issue Nav, you will see all issues, and not the specific search results for your last search.

fields.description:
h3. Summary: 

When a user is deleted from LDAP, it will orphan {{projectroleactor}} records that will be unable to be deleted through the GUI as an error is generated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Add a user to LDAP.
# Setup a LDAP User Directory in JIRA.
# Add that user to a Project Role.
# Delete the user from LDAP.
# Force an LDAP synchronisation.
# Attempt to remove the user from the Project Role - the attached error will be generated.

h3. Expected Results:

The user is deleted from the project role when it is deleted from JIRA.

h3. Actual Results:

The user is not, and the project role is then orphaned.

h3. Regression:

Haven't tested earlier than 4.4.5.

h3. Notes:

Deleting an internal user will remove the project role - refer to the linked issue for more information.
fields.summary: Deleting a user from LDAP will orphan Project Roles and they cannot be deleted

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Many parts of Jira put excessive log messages into the log files regarding form parameters, and servlets. Most prominently, this can be seen when logging in through the login gadget on the dashboard.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log out of Jira
 # Visit the System Dashboard
 # Log in to Jira

h3. Expected Results

The log in completes with no warnings.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the {{catalina.out}} file:
{noformat}
12-Jun-2019 14:41:02.918 WARNING [http-nio-8821-exec-11] com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent.filterFormParameters A servlet request, to the URI http://localhost:8821/j821/rest/gadget/1.0/login, contains form parameters in the request body but the request body has been consumed by the servlet or a servlet filter accessing the request parameters. Only resource methods using @FormParam will work as expected. Resource methods consuming the request body by other means will not work as expected.
{noformat}
(i) Note that the URL will vary wildly depending on the specific usage - this is but one example.
  
h3. Notes

There is an entry in {{log4j.properties}} to address this logging, however the {{WebComponent}} class uses {{java.util.logging}} - which means it doesn't respect the settings in {{log4j.properties}} - and why those settings do not have the desired effect (despite being uncommented in Jira by default).
h3. Workaround
 # Shut down Jira
 # Edit {{$jira-install/conf/logging.properties}}, and add the following at the bottom:
{code:java}
# Suppress log spam about the request body - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30406
com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent.level = SEVERE
com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent.filterFormParameters.level = SEVERE
{code}

 # Restart Jira for the changes to take effect
fields.summary: Jira logs excessive warnings regarding form parameters and servlets
New issue search should not attempt to use unsupported comparisons

fields.description:
h3. Summary: 

When a user's Display Name is changed, it is not updated in the Project Role / People section.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Add a user to a project role as a User.
# Change their display name.
# Refresh the project people page - it is still the same.

h3. Expected Results:

The user's display name is updated in the Project Role people if they are changed.

h3. Actual Results:

The display name is the same. There is no people after change screenshot as it doesn't change.

h3. Regression:

Unable to identify if there was a regression - tested this in 4.4.5 however and was present.

h3. Notes:

To workaround, remove the user then add them back to the project role or restart JIRA. Reindexing does not correct this.
fields.summary: Changing Display Name doesn't update Project Role/People

When creating issues I am doing the following:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30395].
  {panel}

In our documentation for installing JIRA EAR/WAR, eg. :
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Installing+JIRA+on+Tomcat+6.0

Step 3 is to build JIRA which will produce the WAR files.

Step 4.2 contains instructions to remove any duplicate libraries in the JIRA Installation Directory, and if any were found, then to re-build JIRA. Currently, it seems like we bundle specific .jar files which are always duplicated from the .zip archive we also tell users to download and copy to Tomcat's lib directory.

I would suggest that we move the order of Step 3 to come after Step 4.2 as it is now, this way a user is not required to re-build JIRA. The workflow seems like this at the moment:
1. Build JIRA
2. Remove duplicate libraries
3. Re-build JIRA

We could move around the steps so that it would only by:
1. Remove duplicate libraries
2. Build JIRA
fields.summary: Installing JIRA WAR - step order

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30394].
  {panel}

In our documentation for Installing JIRA EAR/WAR on Tomcat, it looks like there is a incorrect path for one of the lib directories.

Using this page as an example:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Installing+JIRA+on+Tomcat+6.0

Section 4.2 mentions:
"To prevent exceptions related to logging, please ensure that the following files are present in Tomcat's lib directory. Also ensure that these files are not present in the webapp/jira/WEB-INF/lib subdirectory of the JIRA Installation Directory. If any of the following files are present in the webapp/jira/WEB-INF/lib subdirectory, remove them and rebuild the deployable JIRA WAR file as described in the previous step (above)."

The subdirectory webapp/jira/WEB-INF/lib subdirectory of the JIRA Installation Directory does not exist.

The correct path in the above example is <jira-install>/webapp/WEB-INF/lib

Not to be confused with the path in the Tomcat installation directory:
<tomcat-install>/webapps/jira/WEB-INF/lib
fields.summary: Installing JIRA WAR documentation - path for libraries incorrect

fields.description:
while testing my Gantt-Chart AddOn for JIRA concerning the coming JIRA 5.2, I have problems concerning searching for issues. The used JQL statements work fine within all JIRA version prior to 5.2. Step by step, I could focus the problem to the NOT-operator. I am using your sample project "Demonstration" and just add an additional customfield of the standard JIRA customfield type "date" (not date/time). For one issue, I set a valid date as you can see on the following screenshot:

!Bildschirmfoto 2012-11-06 um 22.13.57.png!


Then, I am searching for issues having set that date field: DEMO-1, here. This works fine:

!Bildschirmfoto 2012-11-06 um 22.14.42.png!

Now, I want to get all the other 5 issues having not set this date field:

!Bildschirmfoto 2012-11-06 um 22.15.02.png!
Ups, no issues were found, but it should return DEMO-2 until DEMO-6!

fields.description:
In order to reduce excessive notifications, especially via inline editing of values field by field, we've disabled all notifications except for:

Issue Assigned
Issue Commented
Issue Comment Edited

The problem is that when Editing an Issue, changing the assignee or adding a comment is NOT sending a notification.

We are able to fix the "issue assigned" problem by removing the asignee field from the appropriate screens, forcing use of workflow or the Assign button/hot key. 

We are not, however, able to fix the Issue Commented problem, because that field is on the Edit Issue screen by default and we can't remove it.

Ideally, either the Issue Updated notification could be further refined to allow specifing the fields that were changed that would send a notification; or, when updating an issue, Issue Assigned, Issue Commented, etc. events would also be fired off as appropriate so that asignees, watchers, etc. would be appropriately notified.
fields.summary: Notifications not received when Editing Issue, and changing Assignee or Adding Comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30378].
  {panel}

Rather than trying to figure out "which exact panel each setting is in" between "jira admin" and "project admin" and all the sub-categories of settings headings, wouldn't it be great to be able to just "type" the name of the setting you remembered?

For example, "Permission Schemes" is hidden under "Misc". It took me 30 minutes to find it in the new AOD/JIRA UI design. That's just a search for a heading, what about when I can't remember which screen an obscure but critical parameter is on? In these cases, I end up googling it, sifting through 2 or 3 old articles, finding the "where to find this" and then remapping this back to my own config. A little index of the screens plus some autocomplete would save a ton of work.

I have ranked this as "major" given that every time I set about making changes in any part of my atlassian config(s), it generally loses 0.5-2 hours of my day. This in itself isn't the cure, but it would save about 25%.

Applies equally to Standalone and self-hosted.

This request would be similar to apple osx settings panel.
fields.summary: Search for setting feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30377].
  {panel}

JIRA is very difficult to use on Mobile devices without a plugin or a third party app. 

This is a feature request to bundle *anything* which improves this for AOD customers.

Currently, we use AOD with Google Apps authentication, which rules out 100% of the third-party apps.

Suggest free or paid option to include any of the mobile-friendly plugins or (this may be unrelated) allow dual-logins for third party app authentication.
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand mobile support
Navigating to old-style URL for XML view no longer works
Unable to retrieve multiple issues simultaneously using REST API

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

Since 5.1.2, JIRA specifies "X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff" in the headers of all pages. This means that IE will not display any image which was uploaded with the incorrect MIME type. It's hard to reproduce this issue when uploading new images as they are automatically converted to PNG, however any images uploaded in previous versions before this was done are affected. It may also be possible to get such images into JIRA by specifying the wrong MIME type in a REST API request.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Find any image file in JIRA which has the wrong MIME type
# Try to view it in IE

h4. Workaround

Re-upload the image so that it gets converted to PNG.
fields.summary: JIRA will not display images with the wrong MIME type in IE due to nosniff header
As a JIRA Administrator, I believe Issue key should not be displayed at the History/Activity tab when not displayed at Issue Links section

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30371].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 11 January 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

CORS has been supported in the JIRA REST API since JIRA 6.0 for JIRA Server. If you are a JIRA Server customer, simply go to the "Whitelist" section of JIRA Administration and add the domains you wish to request resources from. *Note:* You must have the System Administrator global permission to access this section of JIRA administration.

Unfortunately, this domain whitelist is not available in JIRA Cloud for security reasons. We haven't yet been able to spend time developing a pattern for supporting this in JIRA Cloud, but we do intend to work on this at some point in the future.

I have updated the issue summary to more accurately reflect the current status of this feature.

Regards,

Dave Meyer
 [dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
 Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
JIRA REST API documentation ([http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#authentication]) says: ... if you are using JIRA in a browser you can call REST from Javascript on the page and rely on the authentication that the browser has established.

However it does not work, see my example [http://jsfiddle.net/avalez/nCcq9/2/] and others complains: [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/69356/cross-origin-resource-sharing-with-jira-rest-api-and-javascript]

Looks like Access-Control-Allow-Origin response header is missing.

CAUTION, to make it really work for remote clients, it's necessary to respond with exact match for host name in Access-Control-Allow-Origin header, see related AMKT-3342 ([https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-3342]).
fields.summary: Allow cross-domain requests for CORS
As a JIRA user, I would like the ability to bulk change the link field for several issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30368].
  {panel}

Hello,
In the configuration scheme context, where we choose the Applicable Context, it would be nice to disable the projects list when *Global context* is selected.

It would prevent administrators from choosing a project and forgetting to check the radio button *Apply to issues under selected projects*.

!ApplicableContext.png!

The problem behind the current behavior is that an administrator can almost do the job but because he forgets to check *Apply to issues under selected projects*, all the jira project will be changed.

Thanks,
Best regards.
fields.summary: In Field configuration scheme context, disable projects list when Global context is selected

  {panel}

In the configuration scheme context, where we choose the Applicable Context, it would be nice to disable the projects list when *Global context* is selected.

It would prevent administrators from choosing a project and forgetting to check the radio button *Apply to issues under selected projects*.

!ApplicableContext.png!

The problem behind the current behavior is that an administrator can almost do the job but because he forgets to check *Apply to issues under selected projects*, all the jira project will be changed.

Thanks,

There is a XSS vulnerability in the issue collector: *File:* /atlassian-jira-5.1.8-source/jira-issue-collector-plugin/src/main/resources/templates/view-collector.vm *Line 82:* ${issue.summary} Anonymous users can inject JS in the issue summary which usually will be executed by users with extended permissions. fields.description:
Previously (prior to 5.2), the user or group picker generated jql as

[fieldName] = [value]

If a single value was selected, and

[fieldName] IN ([value1], [value2] ...)

if multiple values were selected.

This has regressed to always generating the second (multiple) option, regardless of how many values are selected.

Also changed is representing eg
[fieldName] in membersOf([groupName])

to

[fieldName] in (membersOf([groupName]))
fields.summary: JQL representation of single user / group picker value

fields.description:
# Create custom user picker field with name "blah"

# jql created is cf[10000]=currentUser(), it should be blah=currentUser()
fields.summary: In new search UI, custom user picker field is converted to jql using cf[id] instead of field name

fields.description:
# Create custom cascading select with 2 values, 'a' and 'b'
# create child value 'aa' under value 'a'
# search for jql: project=blah and CS1=cascadeOption(10000), where 10000 is the id of 'a' - success
# search for jql: project=blah and CS1=cascadeOption(b), where b does not have any children - success
# search for jql: project=blah and CS1=cascadeOption(a), where a does have children - ERROR
fields.summary: Error converting string value from cascading select when value has children

fields.description:
Is not clear how the application is warning about the missing browser plugin when calling the Attached Screenshot tool. Actually, JIRA is redirecting the to java.sun.com and with no messages or instructions.
  
* Steps to reproduce

1. Login to JIRA and create a new ticket.

2. Try to use the Attach Screenshot tool (More Actions > Attach Screenshot)

!first.jpg!

3. If the browser doesn't have the plugin, it will be redirected to java.sun.com page.

!second.jpg!
fields.summary: Missing JRE browser plugin makes JIRA redirecting to page java.sun.com instead of warning about the plugin "failure"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30349].
  {panel}

Many are the times when, in Atlassian Support, we ask our customers to create a Support Zip and send it to us so that we take a look under the hood.

However, there might be times when our friends get a timeout, thus coming back to Support empty-handed.

This can be due to a few factors but perhaps it would make sense for us to include in the documentation a few things to try before calling it a "failure to get the Support Zip":
* Check if they are using a proxy to access JIRA. If so, it makes sense to access JIRA directly (e.g. through port 8080) and try again.
* Check in $JIRA_HOME/export in case the Support Zip is created there anyway and they just get an error in the UI.

I know these two steps are not a _fix_ but, when there is an issue we usually look for a way to bypass this to get to the logs and help with the actual case.
fields.summary: Mention common Support Zip errors in the documentation

fields.description:

When I go to some Issue - all seems fine, time format displays with timezone.
But on dashboard I see incorrect time, there is no timezone - only "z" or 'Z' letter (see second screen).
fields.summary: Incorrect Time displayed on Dashboard when date format changed in "Look and Feel"

fields.description:
JIRA system plugin named "JIRA Welcome Plugin" is not working properly.
# Only the first created user(user_id is 100000 in JIRA is able to uncheck the "Don't show again" and able to have the pop up what's new window when next login. 
# Other users still not able to see the dialog pop up when login.
!Capture.JPG|thumbnail!

Steps to reproduce:
# Install a clean JIRA instance.
# Create two users:
#* "admin" as the first user cretead in JIRA (user_id is 10000)
#* "user"
# Login with username "admin"
#* Enable the "Flag show what's new" module in JIRA Welcome Plugin
#* Exit Administration, go to Profile drop down Menu and click to open the "What's New" page.
#* Un-check the "Don't show again" and close the dialog 
#* Log in again, the dialog will pop up automatically
# Login with username "user"
#* The dialog will not pop up (which supporsely to be pop up automatically as a new user login)
#* Check from the database by running query:
{noformat}
select * from propertystring s, propertyentry e where e.property_key like 'jira.user.whats.new.%' and e.id = s.id;
{noformat}
No data shows up, but then
#* Go back to the JIRA instance, Profile drop down Menu and click to open the "What's New" page.
#* Un-check the "Don't show again" and close the dialog
#* Run the query again in the database, you will find out a following result:
!query.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA Welcome Plugin is not working properly
Add comment during publishing workflow
Add command-line details to Using the JIRA Configuration Tool

fields.description:
h3. Summary: 

When creating a new Activity Stream gadget, if the settings are edited after the initial creation, and then cancelled it will lose those settings until the dashboard is refreshed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Add a new dashboard.
# Add the activity stream to the dashboard.
# Add a filter for one project and save.
# Edit the filter and cancel the change. The filter criteria will appear to be lost.
# Refresh the page. It's back!

h3. Expected Results:

The filter criteria is never lost.

h3. Actual Results:

The filter criteria is lost unless the page is refreshed.

h3. Regression:

Tested in JIRA 5.1.0 / JIRA Activity Stream Plugin 5.1.4 and is not present.

h3. Notes:

The settings aren't actually lost - if this behaviour is encountered, refresh the page to preserve the settings.
fields.summary: Cancelling changes to the Activity Stream results in lost settings
IE9 Formats table cells incorrectly in Issue Search
Ability to access changes stored on the change log tables

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30340].
  {panel}

Before the upgrading, the server.xml has been modified as following:
* Server Port: changed from 8005 to 8008
* Connector Port: changed from 8080 to 28080
* Context path: changed from "" to "/jira"

then upgrade from JIRA 5.1.4 to 5.1.7 by running the "atlassian-jira-5.1.7-x64.bin" installer.
The port numbers will be changed automatically after the upgrade, but the context path will not be changed. We have to modify it again manually. It is expected behavior, but the plugin system initialization may take several minutes, so if I stop the server during the auto-restart period, JIRA will not be able to start up and locked as the data is corrupted.

It will be great if the warning message can be improved to reminds user:
Improve from
{quote}
Custom Modifications
Your previous JIRA installation contains customisations (eg server.xml) that must be manually transferred. Refer to our documentation more information: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Upgrading+JIRA
{quote}

TO

{quote}
Custom Modifications
Your previous JIRA installation contains customisations (eg server.xml) that must be manually transferred. Refer to our documentation more information: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Upgrading+JIRA

Please make sure the JIRA upgrading has been complete and you are able to accessed at http://localhost:8080. Otherwise DO NOT try to stop jira manually, it might cause upgrading fail."
{quote}
fields.summary: Warning message during the upgrading JIRA on Linux

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30324].
  {panel}

As a user, I would like to be able to use non consecutive issue numbers. Instead, I could define a per project numbering scheme. This scheme would be based on variables of different kinds. Some examples:

Current Date (also more customizable)
Num of issues filed this day

Implementation examples:

PRJKT-103112-05 Project_Key-Month_Day_Year-Issue_number_that_day
PRJKT-102012 Project_Key-Month_Year

This would be more in line with the needs and business standards of many Asian Pacific countries.
fields.summary: Customizable Issue Numbers

fields.description:

That part are entries of prefix "navigator.filter.date." and "popups." in [TAC|https://translations.atlassian.com/]. Please see my attached screenshot.

Best regards,
Kan Ogawa
